"light" : "dark")); }; const toggleTOC = () => { setIsTocOpen(!isTocOpen); }; const copyCitation = (event) => { const citationText = `@misc{bradley-optimizers-2024, title={Optimizers ðŸ¥¾ âŽ¯ Towards a full Taxonomy}, author={Bradley, Ben}, year={2024}, month={sep}, note={Blog post}, howpublished={\\url{bbradz.github.com}} }`; navigator.clipboard .writeText(citationText) .then(() => { if (citationCopyButtonRef.current) { citationCopyButtonRef.current.innerHTML = ` `; setTimeout(() => { if (citationCopyButtonRef.current) { citationCopyButtonRef.current.innerHTML = ` `; } }, 2000); } }) .catch((err) => { console.error("Could not copy citation: ", err); alert("Failed to copy citation to clipboard."); }); }; const scrollToTop = () => { window.scrollTo({ top: 0, behavior: "smooth", }); }; const goBack = () => { window.history.back(); }; useEffect(() => { document.body.setAttribute("data-theme", theme); }, [theme]); return (
{" "} {/* Wrapped content in a div */}

Posts Library About Me
{/* Article */}

Optimizers ðŸ¥¾ âŽ¯ Towards a full Taxonomy

Benjamin Bradley, Sun Sep 14 2024 â€¢ 37 min read (7.4K words)
Machine Learning Optimization
{/* ... rest of your article content from TOC downwards ... */}
â–¶ Table of Contents
Prelude Introduction Â Â Explaining Terms Â Â Towards a Taxonomy of Optimizers First-Order Optimizers Â Â SGD-Type Â Â Adam-Type Â Â Triple Moment Adam-Type Optimizers Second-Order Optimizers Information-Geometric Optimizers Conclusions References

Prelude:

{/* ... Article body ... */}

Last Sunday I released an article onto this blog breaking down at a moderately exhaustive level the new Algoperf optimizer benchmark. Given that my RL research with the Physics department at Brown University has been winding down I've strongly been looking for some way to transition my attention over towards the hard-CS side of things, where my more truly heart is, I really enjoyed writing that piece and it served a real purpose in my life which is part of why I'm back here today writing about the field of study which spawned{" "} Algoperf, Optimizers!

Machine Learning as a field is absolutely ginormous, ginormous enough in fact that I can't avoid a feeling of intense humility whenever I talk about it; It amazes me how little of it's breadth, despite my efforts, I can comfortably lay claim to understanding at a nuts & bolts level. When I was writing about Algoperf I hadn't intended to dedicate a whole article to the topic, moreso it proved to be an inavoidable topic on a much longer path, a path which I intend to continue following today.

{/* ... Rest of the article content ... */} {/* Sources section moved to bottom */}
